themes: insufficient funding for public art and murals
burdensome administrative processes and payout schedules
lack of protection for existing public artworks
inconsistent and unclear grant application processes
problems with grant review panel engagement and evaluation criteria
lack of recognition of artist identity and lived experience
key_phrases: AIPP budgets, particularly for murals, are unreasonably low
extended timelines and stratified payout schedules place an undue burden on artists
AIPP intended to allow works in their archive to be demolished without protection
community and artist advocacy halted this
Nexus grant process was inconsistent and frustrating
review process was also extended multiple times
feedback was not only inaccurate but offensive
box-checking took precedence over meaningful evaluation
barriers_identified: low budgets for public art relative to cost of living
risk of demolition of archived works
inconsistent and unclear grant application requirements
disengaged and potentially biased review panels
lack of recognition of artist's community identity
solutions_proposed: increase AIPP budgets for murals to reflect Austin's cost of living
streamline or improve payout schedules to reduce burden on artists
ensure permanent protection for works in the AIPP archive
maintain consistent and meaningful grant application requirements
improve review panel engagement and accuracy of feedback
